item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Middle-aged man trading cards go viral in rural Japan town (873 points | 178 comments)
2. Any program can be a GitHub Actions shell (117 points | 17 comments)
3. Show HN: Browser MCP – Automate your browser using Cursor, Claude, VS Code (426 points | 158 comments)
4. Deleting multiplayer from the Unreal engine can save memory (55 points | 15 comments)
5. Show HN: Lux – A luxurious package manager for Lua (200 points | 70 comments)
6. Smallest Pacemaker Is the Size of a Rice Grain (21 points | 3 comments)
7. 'Exploding' Tunnock's teacakes cleared by tests to fly again (34 points | 8 comments)
8. What Was Quartz? (88 points | 37 comments)
9. India's repair culture gives new life to dead laptops (80 points | 38 comments)
10. A Supermarket Bag and a Truckload of FOMO (64 points | 10 comments)
11. Unmasking EncryptHub: Help from ChatGPT and Opsec Blunders (19 points | 1 comment)
12. Fifty Years of Open Source Software Supply Chain Security (133 points | 60 comments)
13. Ethically sourced "spare" human bodies could revolutionize medicine (19 points | 29 comments)
14. Ancient Dagger Up to 2.5k Years Old W Stars/Moons/Geometric Patterns Unearthed (54 points | 8 comments)
15. Scaffold Level Editor (88 points | 19 comments)
16. Beyond Quacking: Deep Integration of Language Models and RAG into DuckDB (70 points | 11 comments)
17. Interviewing a software engineer who prepared with AI (157 points | 248 comments)
18. Why Companies Don't Fix Bugs (75 points | 35 comments)
19. An FPGA-based LGP-30 Replica (21 points | 3 comments)
20. Hasochism: The pleasure and pain of dependently typed Haskell programming [pdf] (2013) (79 points | 12 comments)
21. Decoding the 90s: Cryptography in Early Software Development (2023) (109 points | 34 comments)
22. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (543 points | 424 comments)
23. PiDP-1, or the rebirth of an old machine (87 points | 30 comments)
24. Show HN: Minimal MCP server in Go showcasing project architecture (46 points | 5 comments)
25. 20 years of Git (248 points | 181 comments)
26. Fuck Run Club, Join Sit Club (64 points | 27 comments)
27. Glamorous Toolkit (316 points | 121 comments)
28. Drag racers are ditching superchargers for scuba-style tanks and compressed air (28 points | 72 comments)
29. In the 1980s we also downloaded software from TV (41 points | 17 comments)
30. We asked camera companies why their RAW formats are all different and confusing (349 points | 203 comments)
